Posts.Content: Hi ,   I had 4 FEC at 3 weekly intervals and then 12 weekly TAXOL. I worked throughout with just chemo day off as the side effects weren't bad. I did get some awful spots on my face and a little bit of tingling in my fingers. However it does hammer your white blood cell count as I had it weekly - so I did flounder a little around no 8 and had to have a couple of weeks off. Still I managed to complete the whole course without any real issues.   Good luck - its a whole lot easier than FEC. x
Posts.Title: taxol

Posts.Content: Hi   I had a port fitted before my chemo started. I did have private treatment though through my company health scheme so I am not sure if they are available on the NHS.   They are brilliant - all chemo ,blood tests and Herceptin are given/taken through them  - they sit completely under the skin so there is little risk of infection and they don't need flushing every week so very low maintenance. If you can I would push for this option.
Posts.Title: FEC - unco-operative veins!!!....and advice on PICC line

Posts.Content: Does everybody put on extra weight with chemotherapy and if so why?
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy - weight gain?

Posts.Content: Hi   Start my first FEC on 1st August and really want to keep my hair so trying the cold cap - any tips or advice you can offer re that would be great.   I have added you as a friend Ethel if that is ok as that might be easier to chat   Vicki
Posts.Title: For anyone about to start or going through chemo.....

Posts.Content: I have used aqueas cream liberally throughout and I have been ok - till these boosters!! Now I am really worried about the area round the nipple as its red, sore and weeping !! Just wondered if there was anything else I can use.

Posts.Content: Thank you ladies - as always you can rely on this site :-)
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - Help please

Posts.Content: Thank you for replying x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - Help please

Posts.Content: I wish he had - unfortunately he was clueless!! I am seeing the radiographeirs at the hospital on Thursday and hopefully they will give me something. They have suggested I just keave it for the moment to dry out!!
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - Help please

Posts.Content: Hi I have just finished 18 sessions of radiotherapy - 15 full breast and 3 booster sessions. Although my breast is a ittle pink generally it is fine. However today my aereola has been really sore and I have noticed tonight that it is weepy. I  am still applying E45 but is there anything else I can use on this area - I am worried it will get infected. Thanks Vicki x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - Help please

Posts.Content: Thanks Ann Marie - by some miracle I hav managed to get a GP appointment for 8.30 so I cam go before work. Hasn helped that although I am really tired I found getting to sleep last night impossible. My breast was so sore I just couldnt get comfortable plus for some reason my legs were aching - hopefully not the Tamoxifen (only been on it a week)!!! Aaaargh - soooo annoying!!
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - Help please

Posts.Content: Hi.   I don't know if anyone has had the same problems as me but I have been on Tamoxifen about 3 months and I feel really anxious and weepy for a lot of the time. It is totally different to how my normal personality is and I am finding it very difficult to deal with.   I really don't want to go onto antidepressants so was wondering if anyone else had tried any natural remedies or if symtpoms eased after being on it longer. Apart from that I don't seem to be suffering.   Thanks Vickix
Posts.Title: Does anyone else feel low and anxious on Tamoxifen?

Posts.Content: Do you think your symptoms have got any easier though  with time. I am being told to give it time and  that it will probably setlle down?
Posts.Title: Does anyone else feel low and anxious on Tamoxifen?

Posts.Content: Thank you for your answer - I need to do something as I don't feel I can carry on taking it when it is making me feel so bad. Cancer was a piece of cake compared to this....   Do you know if there are any natural remedies that can be taken - another lady was talking about vitamin B.
Posts.Title: Does anyone else feel low and anxious on Tamoxifen?

Posts.Content: Hi Beverley,   how long had you been on it for?
Posts.Title: Does anyone else feel low and anxious on Tamoxifen?

Posts.Content: it isn't fair - but not much we can do about it apart from just get on with it I guess. It looks like perseverance is the only option!! :-(
Posts.Title: Does anyone else feel low and anxious on Tamoxifen?

Posts.Content: I am thinking of going abroad - I have been perfectly well so I cant see any reason why not to. My wbc is up to normal levels by the third week so I cant see that I am at any more risk than a "normal" person. Does anyone else agree??
Posts.Title: Holidays

Posts.Content: Has anyone been on holiday inbetween chemo sessions? I have been very well on the FEC  and am thinking of going on my 3rd week.   Anyone else done this?
Posts.Title: Holidays

Posts.Content: I am 48 and was already going through the menopause before I found my lump. To ease vaginal dryness I used locally applied oestrogen cream a couple of times a week. Is it still ok to use and if not what else is there?   Any advice appreciated - I can cope with the BC but this is a pain!!   Vicki x
Posts.Title: Can we use oestrogen creams for vaginal dryness if the tumour is oestrogen...

Posts.Content: Hi I have had 4 FEC and start weekly TAXOL not TAXOTERE in a few weeks. Has anyone had this rather than the TAXOTERE? According to my oncologist the side effects are far less but the NHS don't offer it because it has to be administered weekly, which I think is absolutely disgusting ?? If anyone has any experience to share I would be grateful.
Posts.Title: Paclitaxel - TAXOL

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed on 4th July with stage 2 grade 2 - only went to GP on 3rd Have now had clear sentinel node biopsy and CT scan Consultant has put a wire in to mark the tumour as the chemo is going to shrink it to nothing hopefully Start the first of 4 FEC 1st August and then weekly Taxol for 12 weeks to shrink tumour. Then possibly small lumpectomy and then 4 weeks radiotherapy -WOW I am going to try the cold cap but have also been to sort out a wig today just in case All this in 2 weeks !!!! And at the moment I feel fantastic Hard to believe its real But I am sure it is down to HRT I am only 48 a don't drink , don't smoke, breast fed all my children etc etc So very low risk - then I took HRT and within 18 months got this I feel there has to be a link Vicki
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed..

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed on 4th July with stage 2 grade 2 - only went to GP on 3rd Have now had clear sentinel node biopsy and CT scan Consultant has put a wire in to mark the tumour as the chemo is going to shrink it to nothing hopefully Start the first of 4 FEC 1st August and then weekly Taxol for 12 weeks to shrink tumour. Then possibly small lumpectomy and then 4 weeks radiotherapy -WOW I am going to try the cold cap but have also been to sort out a wig today just in case All this in 2 weeks !!!! And at the moment I feel fantastic Hard to believe its real But I am sure it is down to HRT I am only 48 a don't drink , don't smoke, breast fed all my children etc etc So very low risk - then I took HRT and within 18 months got this I feel there has to be a link Vicki
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed..

Posts.Content: Hi Chris There is no real family history in my family although a cousin did die - however I do know a lot about genetic breast cancer as it is in my husbands family and his mum died at 49 of it and his sister had it at 39 plus numerous aunts and cousins If your team are basing you having genetic breast cancer on one aunt then that is a remote link bearing in mine only 10% of breast cancer is genetic !! Like you I am also not overweight so HRT is the only obvious choice What is your treatment plan ? Have you had the sentinel node and CT ? Vicki
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed..
